name: Number of countries with a given status on the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons
descriptionProcessing:
- Countries are classified as "Approved" if they have either a "Ratification", "Accession", or "Succession" action (as defined by UNODA).
- Countries are classified as "Signed" if they only have a "Signatory" action  (as defined by UNODA).
- Countries are classified as "Withdrawn" if they have a "Withdrawal" action (as defined by UNODA).
- Countries are classified as "Not signed" if they have none of the previous actions.

presentation.titlePublic: Number of countries with a given status on the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons

descriptionKey: The status "Signed" means that a country accepts a treaty without a legal commitment.
The status "Approved" means that the country has legally committed to a treaty.
The status "Not signed" means that the country has neither signed nor committed to a treaty.
The status "Withdrawn" means that the country has withdrawn from its legal commitment to a treaty.

origins.title: Treaties Database
origins.descriptionSnapshot: This dataset contains the status of countries that have participated in the Protocol for the Prohibition of the Use in War of Asphyxiating, Poisonous or Other Gases, and of Bacteriological Methods of Warfare (Geneva Protocol).
origins.description: Since 1978, the United Nations has been publishing the status of multilateral Arms Regulation and Disarmament Agreements, presenting data on signatories, parties of relevant agreements and the texts of the agreements themselves.
origins.producer: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs
origins.citationFull: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs - Treaties Database (2024).
